thread.title: Eastie man charged with false alarm at Logan hotel
thread.title_full: Eastie man charged with false alarm at Logan hotel

author: Laurel J. Sweet
title: Eastie man charged with false alarm at Logan hotel
text:
Laurel J. Sweet Sunday, January 22, 2017 Credit: Mark Garfinkel A State police cruiser sits in front of Logan airport Hilton, the same hotel where the Pittsburgh Steelers were awakened early this morning after a fire alarm was pulled. Staff photo by Mark Garfinkel comments 
State police arrested an East Boston man early this morning for allegedly pulling a fire alarm at a Logan Airport hotel, where members of the Pittsburgh Steelers reportedly were sleeping ahead of tonight's AFC Championship game against the New England Patriots. 
Dennis Harrison, 25, was not a guest of the Hilton, "and had no legitimate reason to be on the hotel property," police said in a statement. 
Police said the alarm went off at about 3:40 a.m. News reports indicated the Steelers were guests at the hotel. 
Cops said Harrison was still walking the property when police arrived. 
He was charged with disorderly conduct, disturbing the peace and setting off a false alarm. Related Articles
